item.title: Twitter APIs
item.description: Twitter data gatekeeping Even before the unpresidented Twitter-centric 2016 U.S. election, researchers flocked to Twitter data (Lee, Yoon, Smith, Park, & Park, 2017; Peoples, Midway, Sackett, Lynch, & Cooney, 2016; Priem & Costello, 2010; Shuai, Pepe, & Bollen, 2012). Why? Well, aside from the obvious–that it’s an immensely popular social media platform–Twitter attracts scholarly attention because it makes a lot of its data freely available to the public via Application Program Interfaces (APIs).
